paper_abstract: Based on a unified representation of generalized cyclotomic classes, every generalized cyclotomic sequence of order d over Z(p1)(p2)(e1)(e2)...(er)(pr) is shown to be a sum of d-residue sequences over Z(ps)(es) for s is an element of {1, 2, ... , r}. For d = 2, by the multi-rate approach, several generalized cyclotomic sequences are explicitly expressed by Legendre sequences, and their linear complexity properties are analyzed.
paper_title: Multi-Rate Representation of Generalized Cyclotomic Sequences of Any Odd Period
